channel.title: [PI]Items invisible in inventory
channel.description: So I added a custom slayer helm to the source, when I wear it, it works fine, but its invisible in the inventory, same for every other custom item[img]http://i.imgur.com/V42AhVX.png[/img]

item.title: [PI]Items invisible in inventory
item.dc:creator: @xfukecx xfukecx
item.description:
@xfukecx wrote:

I dont think thats it, if I put in a random model number, player is still visible, he just holds nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Items invisible in inventory
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xfukecx:

ok, I got it working, now I added blowpipe, and I see it in my inventory, but my character goes invisible when I wear it. And when I open “show equipment stats” my client crashes

Now you have the reverse problem of what I said.

Instead of the inventory models missing. Now you are missing the wield models.
That would be the anInt165 and anInt200 I mentioned earlier. They may be named maleEquipModel or some other naming.

Read full topic

@xfukecx wrote:

ok, I got it working, now I added blowpipe, and I see it in my inventory, but my character goes invisible when I wear it. And when I open “show equipment stats” my client crashes

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Items invisible in inventory
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Possible reasons:

  1. Missing the inventory model
  2. Inventory model isn’t seen (Your ints are bad)
  3. Inventory model is set to equip model and the ints for it are bad.
  4. Your ints are bad.

This is handled within the client. Look for your item in the ItemDef (or similar) file, and edit the values.
if there’s a value like modelId or model, that value is your inventory model.
anInt165 is male wield, and anInt200 is female. The rest should be the values that change the look in the inventory.

Read full topic
